snippet: The military appeals court cited the appearance of bias in the judge, Col. Gregory Gross, after he ordered Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, the Army psychiatrist charged in a 2009 attack at Fort Hood, forcibly shaved before his trial.
abstract: Military appeals court orders removal of Col Gregory Gross, judge presiding over prosecution of Maj Nidal Malik Hasan, Army psychiatrist charged in deadly shooting rampage at Fort Hood in Texas;  cites Gross's appearance of bias after he ordered Hasan be forcibly shaved before start of his trial.
lead_paragraph: The military appeals court cited the appearance of bias in the judge, Col. Gregory Gross, after he ordered Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, the Army psychiatrist charged in a 2009 attack at Fort Hood, forcibly shaved before his trial.

headline.seo: Military Court Removes Judge in Fort Hood Rampage Trial
headline.main: Court Ousts Trial Judge in Rampage at Ft. Hood
headline.print_headline: Court Ousts Judge in Trial In Rampage At Army Base

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
